criterion: Reward for correctly documenting that insulin glargine is to continue at 26 units at bedtime with no dose change pending review of glucose logs.
Reward for recording that semaglutide is being taken weekly at a starting dose of 0.25 mg and that the clinician counseled about possible mild nausea.
Reward for stating that glyburide has been stopped and the patient was advised to include a bedtime snack to reduce overnight hypoglycemia risk.
Reward for capturing the contingency plan: if mid-day glucose exceeds 200 mg/dL, patient is to call and clinician may add 2 units of rapid-acting insulin before lunch.
Reward for documenting storage instructions for the semaglutide pen (keep in vaccine cooler; gel packs to be supplied).
Reward for including refill logistics (nurse to call every fourth Thursday and option to pick up at co-op dropbox if weather delays delivery).
Reward for noting the immediate administrative plan: fax lab slip today and schedule a six-week phone review.

Reward for accurately reflecting the patient’s expressed concerns (nausea, dizziness while farming, weight loss, refrigeration failure, after-lunch glucose spikes, travel distance) in the HPI/subjective section.
Penalize for introducing medical decisions, diagnoses, medications, or counseling not present in either the transcript or the chart (fabrication or unwarranted inference).
Penalize for omitting more than two of the key elements listed above, indicating inadequate overall completeness relative to the transcript.
Penalize for copying chart information not referenced in the encounter (e.g., congestive heart failure, osteoarthritis) or outdated medications, thereby adding irrelevant content.
